abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Southern Transport Project in Lao
            People's Democratic Republic. The project was designed
            to: a) carry out repairs and maintenance of Highway 13 in
            the provinces of Savannakhet, Saravanne and Champassak; b)
            strengthen the maintenance capacity of the three provincial
            Road and Bnrdge Maintenance Societies (RBMSs); and c)
            complete studies for future transport development.
            Bank's performance was satisfactory. Overall
            implementation by the Borrower was satisfactory. The main
            lessonst o be drawn from the experienceo f implementationo f
            the project were: (i) that the complex and time consuming
            government administrative and procurement procedures
            involved with ICB procurement should have been anticipated
            and that technicala ssistance shouldh ave been consideredt o
            supplement he Borrower's weak institutional capacity;
            (ii) that more authority should be delegated to the line
            ministry to manage the project, particularly with regard to
            disbursement matters; (iii) thatt he implementationp rocess
            helped to evolvea prototype of an acceptable and possibly a
            sustainable approach to privatization of the construction
            sector in the country; and (iv) that the basis of future
            cumulative progress in the sector should be based on careful
            planning of the next phase, based on a clear assessment of
            what is absorbed by those involved in the implementation process.

18156998.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The Southern Transport Project supports
            a program of repairs and maintenance for an economically
            critical road section and strengthening capabilities for
            planning and executing road maintenance on a continuing
            basis.  To that end, it includes: (a) spot improvements of
            the existing pavement and drainage systems including
            bridges, on about 270 km of Route 13 in Savannakhet,
            Saravane and Champassak provinces; and (b) procurement of
            road maintenance and mechanical workshop equipment, bridge
            panels and construction materials.  The project further
            provides (c) consultant services to assist in procurement
            and project implementation and also to carry out a series of
            transport improvement and project preparation studies.  The
            principal benefits of the project will arise from the
            savings in vehicle operating costs due to road improvements.
